text: Bottle at Sommelier. Transparent. Melon aroma, pear and melon taste. Light body, smooth, fruity and long finish. Nicer.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours as water, nose is floral, fruity, pineapple, taste is a little harsh, dry, chalky.
Bottle at home... Clear... Soft dry fruit.. Big spirit... Big licorice nose... Mellow fruits.. Long soft licorice.. Big alcohol
Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Clear. Nose is anise, fruity tones. rice, alcohol, sweet notes. Flavor is boozy, ricey, some dryness. Lingering light marzipan. Pretty sippable.

0,3L bottle (from one of the Liviko Alcostores in Tallinn). (I assume this is the right one, although the Estonian label says its ABV 14,5%, Japanese label seems to indicate its between 14-15). Aroma is sweet, alcohol, and anise. Flavor is sweet, anise, maybe even fruits, rice, some cedar like notes, some alcohol. Overall: very easy to sip, nice brew.

Poured into a glass at Tomoe sushi. Clear pour. Minty and clear aroma. A bit sweet throughout with abrupt and less balanced finish. Easy to drink and approach for people who do not like sake. Overall, not bad

Bottle brought back from Japan by the wife. A crystal clear color. A rich fruity perfumy nose, very much like melons and flowers. Sweet, rich earthy melon, some cold watery smoothness, grainy rice, heat. Interesting for sure. Quite good. As with most Sake I find this overly hot.
Bottle shared by Carl. Pour is clear. The aroma is Fruit and rice. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet fruit and nice crisp finish. A good sake.
Botella, 30cl., bought in a supermarket in Yanai, Yamaguchi. Clear slightly yellow colour. Strong rice aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Strong rice  flavour with alcohol, some sweetness, bit harsh.
Bottle at Alexs. Pours a clear, almost colourless. Smells of marzipan and spirits. Sweet and quite dry. Also aromas of rice. Warming alcohol finish.

Bottle @ Ulfborg, Early Winter Tasting, 2011. Pours clear no color with no head. Boozy and sharp sweet alcohol. Rice and honey. Dry and warm.

Bottle. A clear one, almost colorless. Some cooked rice on the nose, rather fruity too, and with a touch of something boozy, without being boozy though. Dry, lighlty oily and warming on the palate. Some boozy flavors and also some cooked rice. Quite fruity flavor that lasts. A decent sake indeed, but a bit boozy-feeling. I like the fruityness though. 111105
Clear as water. Aroma is sweet, rice, fruity and pepper. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with some alcohol. 051111
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almond an spices. Flavour is rice, medium sweet, almond, alcohol and spices.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are almonds, alcohol and ricemalt.

Bottle 300ml. @ home.[ Trade by fiulijn ]. Cristal clear water colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, alcohol, moderate fruity, pineapple, coconut. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet with a long duration, rice, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20111012]
30 cL bottle. Pours clear. Aroma is mild fruity, peachy. Crisp peachy and fruity. Smooth, wineous, fruity, light citric and crisp. Lingering fruity finish.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Pours pretty much crystal clear. Sweet spicy nose with a subtle woodiness. Medium body, sweet exotic fruit notes with a warming alcohol in the finish. Delicious indeed. 020911
Bottle at Alexs Place, Malmø. Clear watery - no head. Cedar, fruity, rice, minerals, light flowery, nice medium cedar, ok freshness.

Bottled. a water colored sake. the aroma has notes of rice, alcohol, and cedar wood. the flavor is sweet with notes of rice and cedar wood, leading to an alcoholic finish. the mouthfeel is very soft. Thanks fiulijn for sharing.

Bottle from Whistler Wine & Spirits, a few years old; 15% ABVThe transparent fluid has the palest hue of green. Nice elegant aroma, some lemongrass, melon, alcohol, pepper, phenol, very refreshing. Very smooth mouthfeel, with a good body; mild delicate fruits, and a warm alcoholic finish; some sweetness to in the final. Good.

150 ml Can. Three years past its drink by, though it has been refrigerated the whole time. 
Slightly sweet aroma, with caramel, peach, condensed milk. Clear and slightly viscous. Slightly oxidized flavor, with melon and pear, pepper, milk, caramel. Alcohol very noticeable, with a tingle on the tongue. Rather high acidity. Clean and crisp. This is generally a rather light-flavored ginjo, and I think the extra age has probably made it more characterful. Decent stuff, though still a bit too subtle and light (=watery=mizu no gotoshi).

Poured from 750ml into guinomi: cold: My first sake rating, but not my first tasting.  Tasted with a delicious salmon and mahi mahi dish.  Pours perfectly clear.  Nose is very floral, light fruits.  The floral notes continue into the taste but are, however, nicely balanced by the dry quality. Light in body yet deep in taste, very easily drinkable.

300ml bottle: Niigata-ken is known throughout Japan as the "Mecca" for top notch sake. Clear as mountain spring water. Jordan pretty much nailed the scent dead on. It is interesting to compare various "Junmai" and non "Junmai" types of sake to see how the added alcohol really changes the the sake, not only the aroma and taste but the feel as well. This does have a dry flavor that reminds me a bit of vermouth. I tried this at several temperatures, the best being either very cold or warm (not hot)., chilled (as I prefer most sake) doesnt work for this one.

180mL Bottle: Clear, nose of light fruity butter, sweet and chewy nose, very light anise, some alcohol and dry rice notes. The flavor is clean and light, a sweet impact with fruit and a dry alcoholic mouthfeel. The finish is short and dry, leaving a peanut shell note lingering on the tongue. Nice nose and initial impact, but its a challenge to drink after that. I think Ive had this one before
